org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.impl

Interface DomainProfileObjectStore

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DomainProfileObjectStoreImpl

    public interface DomainProfileObjectStore
    Maintain a set of domain objects described by a domain profile and allow their properties to be manipulated.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • updateObject

        void updateObject(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.ipm.Node node)
        Modify the domain object of a node such that it is consistent with the domain profiles specified by the node. The domain object of the parent node already exist. If the domain object already exists, any existing types on the object will be removed. Any existing properties of the domain object will be kept, although they may mean the object is not valid with respect to the domain profiles specified in the node. Any existing relations between the domain object and its parent will be removed. If the node does not have a domain object, create a new object and set it's identifier on the node. Structural relations between the node and its parent will be set as specified by the primary domain profile of the node. Default properties and system supplied properties will be added from each domain profile of the node.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to update.

      • deleteObject

        void deleteObject(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.ipm.Node node)
        Delete the domain object of a node. Any relations between that domain object and the domain objects of its parent or child nodes are removed. The state of the node itself is not modified.
        Parameters:
        node - The node whose domain object should be deleted.

      • moveObject

        void moveObject(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.ipm.Node node,
                org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.dprofile.NodeType new_node_type,
                org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.ipm.Node new_parent)
        Move one node to another, optionally changing the type of the node, and updating their associated domain objects. The resulting tree must be valid.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to move.
        new_node_type - If non-null, the new type to set on the node.
        new_parent - The new parent of the node.

      • addProperty

        void addProperty(URI object,
                 org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.dprofile.Property prop)
        Add a property to a domain object. Only one simple property with a given value may be on an object. Others are ignored. Multiple complex properties with the same value may be added.
        Parameters:
        object - The identifier of the object to modify.
        prop - The value to add.

      • removeProperty

        void removeProperty(URI object,
                    org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.dprofile.Property prop)
        Remove a particular property from a n object.
        Parameters:
        object - The identifier of the object to modify.
        prop - The value to remove.

      • removeProperty

        void removeProperty(URI object,
                    org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.dprofile.PropertyType type)
        Remove all properties of a given type from a object.
        Parameters:
        object - The identifier of the object to modify.
        type - The type of the properties to remove.

      • getProperties

        List<org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.dprofile.Property> getProperties(URI object,
                                                                               org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.dprofile.NodeType type)
        Parameters:
        object - The identifier of an object.
        type - The node type which the object corresponds to.
        Returns:
        All properties of an object specified by a node type.

      • getProperties

        Parameters:

        type - The type of properties to retrieve.
        Returns:
        All properties of an object specified of the given type.

      • hasRelationship

                        URI predicate,
                        URI object)
        Check for the existence of a relationship.
        Parameters:
        subject - The identifier of an object.
        predicate - The identifier of a predicate.
        object - The identifier of an object.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the relationship exists.
